function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increasing outside air fractions may lead to increased energy consumption","Impact":"Increased energy consumption can lead to higher operating costs for the building and may discourage building operators from implementing this mitigation technique","Mitigation":"Use energy-efficient HVAC systems and technologies to minimize the impact of increased air fractions on energy consumption","Technologies":"Energy-efficient HVAC systems, air duct insulation, demand-controlled ventilation","People":"Building operators, facility managers","Owner":"Building management, energy efficiency consultants"},{"Description":"Not all air-handling systems have capacity to substantially increase outside air ratios","Impact":"Inability to increase outside air ratios limits the effectiveness of the mitigation technique, potentially leaving occupants at risk","Mitigation":"Invest in air-handling systems with the capability to increase outside air fractions, or implement alternative measures to improve indoor air quality","Technologies":"High-capacity air-handling systems, air quality sensors, portable air purifiers","People":"Building operators, facility managers","Owner":"Building management, air system manufacturers"},{"Description":"High airflow rates without increased outside air fraction can increase transmission potential of contagious diseases","Impact":"Increased transmission potential of contagious diseases poses a health risk to building occupants","Mitigation":"Focus on increasing outside air fraction along with airflow rates, and utilize air purification technologies to reduce the transmission potential of indoor air","Technologies":"Air purification systems, ultraviolet germicidal irradiation, high-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters","People":"Building operators, facility managers, building occupants","Owner":"Building management, air purifier manufacturers"}]}
